Yes, there are a few specific features you might want to look out for when choosing between mesh networking devices or routers:

1. Speed: Mesh networking devices or routers have different maximum speeds. Look for devices that support the latest Wi-Fi standards like 802.11ac or 802.11ax (also known as Wi-Fi 6) to ensure fast speeds. 2. Coverage Area: Consider the size of your home and the number of access points needed to cover it. Some mesh networking systems have additional nodes that can be added to increase coverage. 3. Compatibility: Ensure that any mesh networking devices or routers you purchase are compatible with your existing devices, especially if you have older devices in your network. 4. Customer Service and Support: Consider the customer service and support offered by the manufacturer, so you can get help if you encounter any issues. 5. Advanced Features: Some mesh networking devices or routers have advanced features that might be useful, such as parental controls, guest networks, or USB ports for sharing files or printers. 6. Security: Check the security features offered by mesh networking devices or routers, such as WPA3 or VPN support, to protect your home network. Overall, consider your needs and usage before making a decision, as different devices may be better suited for different situations.
